content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 303.5 - Prohibition on bicycle riding on the Atlantic Beach Bridge

State Regulations
(a) Definitions. Whenever used in this

Chapter, unless a different meaning clearly appears from the context, the terms
herein shall be defined as follows: (1)

Bicycle includes vehicles with two wheels, one in front of the other, having a
saddle seat for the rider, steered by a handle bar and driven by
pedals. (2)

Roller skates includes
a skate with small wheels instead of a runner for skating on a surface other
than ice. (3)

Scooter includes a
vehicle that consists typically of a narrow footboard mounted between two
wheels tandem with an upright handle attached to the front wheel that is
operated by placing one foot on the footboard and pushing with the other
foot. (4)

Skateboard includes a
vehicle that consists typically of a narrow footboard mounted between four
small wheels that is operated by placing one foot on the footboard and pushing
with the other foot. (b) Operation prohibited in certain areas. It shall be unlawful for any person or
persons to ride or operate a bicycle, roller skates, scooter or skateboard upon
the pedestrian walkway located on the western side of the Atlantic Beach Bridge
within the Villages of Atlantic Beach and Lawrence. (c) Violations and penalties. Any person
violating any of the provisions of this ordinance shall be a civil traffic
offense punishable by a fine of not less than $50 nor more than $250 for each
offense. Notes
